definition: to plan/to lay out/to design
to plan a project/to stand on tiptoe/Taiwan pr. [qi4]/abbr. for 企業|企业[qi3 ye4]
to cut/to slash/to scratch (cut into the surface of sth)/to strike (a match)
to delimit/to transfer/to assign/to plan/to draw (a line)/stroke of a Chinese character

sentences.english: In view of the development prospects of the Chinese market at present, he does some market research.
sentences.chinese: 鑑於目前中國市場的發展前景，他做了一個行銷企劃。

sentences.english: I'll be quarterbacking every meeting and every project.
sentences.chinese: 我將會主持所有會議及負責所以企劃案。

sentences.english: To draft market planning book and carry it out after approval.
sentences.chinese: 制定營銷企劃書經過批准後落實。

sentences.english: Don't worry. We still have a week to finish the project.
sentences.chinese: 別擔心，我們還有一個禮拜可以完成這個企劃案。

sentences.english: Also included are a few sample proposals we have put together for your company.
sentences.chinese: 還包括了我們爲貴公司做的幾個企劃案樣本。

sentences.english: Before you turn in our project, there are a few small amendments I'd like to make.
sentences.chinese: 在你交出我們的企劃案之前，我想做一些小修正。

sentences.english: So I was promoted from senior designer to the supervisor of planning department.
sentences.chinese: 我的職務也由資深設師升爲企劃部主管。

sentences.english: The way of making meeting document.
sentences.chinese: 現代會議文書與企劃書的製作。

sentences.english: Today we have scheduled three proposal presentations.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們安排了三個企劃說明會。

sentences.english: The Planning Department is in charge of the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 此次會議由企劃部負責。

sentences.english: I'm developing a kid's television show.
sentences.chinese: 我在企劃一檔兒童電視節目。

sentences.english: Bob: What kind of proposal is it?
Mr. brown , can i put off my final propsal until next week?
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生，我可不可以企劃書推遲到下週交呢？

sentences.english: If possible, I'd like to start in the planning department.
sentences.chinese: 如果可能，我希望從企劃部開始。

sentences.english: Tom: Today, general manager gave me a proposal.
sentences.chinese: 今天，總經理給了我一個企劃案。

definition: animation/cartoon
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
voice actor (loanword from Japanese 声優 seiyū)
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
to belong or be dedicated exclusively to/proprietary/private/personal
on the eve of/to be about to/to be on the verge of
manufacturer/producer
popular/hot/in vogue
jointly (signed, declared, sponsored)
to come up with an idea/generation of ideas/inspiration
variant of 計劃|计划[ji4 hua4]
public/to publish/to make public
to release/to make available/to liberate/disengagement
caricature/cartoon/Japanese manga
to rush (to do sth urgent)/to try to be the first/to forestall
to draw/to draft
